turns.text: Well that Ive been aware of Ive - at least in my own circles Ive been aware of an increasing from my generation - I dont know if I can quite call myself distinct generation from you but half generation off I guess Um Ive noticed uh certain increase um pessimism with America no longer being sort of on top I had the impression - well I mean there was the quote unquote losing of the Vietnam war which was blow and it was right around that time when I started becoming socially you know socially conscious adult And I realize that people of my age have no um no major success in the sense that uh you saw the passage of the Civil Rights Act and um major social change in that sense and I - and all the changes that have happened in the last uh even during my adulthood have been more incremental Theyve been continual perhaps and good gains have been made but there hasnt been the same sort of fiery speeches of Martin Luther King or whatever that has really uh galvanized the population And theres just - instead theres been sort of an increasing oh I dont know Japan bashing and things like that
turns.label: sd

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: And uh lot of - I see among some of my friends and even more among some of my students who are you know maybe twenty real sense of you know Americas losing it
Yes
turns.label: aa

turns.text: And losing it in the competitive market and real knowl- uh - lack of understanding how that could be In the sense that how could America have gone from being number one to possibly being number two to - you know our former enemies and things like that - and uh so I see I see lot of uh lot of pessimism growing um and at the same time I think theres theres theres growing environmentalist movement and sense of corporate respon- increased corporate responsible towards uh you know environmental safety and things like that And that might potentially be sort of the civil right the equivalent of the Civil Rights Act in in the near future in terms of you know some real landmark bills passing and things like that Such that you know people - The thing about civil rights is people take it for granted now I mean my generation doesnt cant rest on the the glow of having achieved civil rights because we were born into an assumption that you know yes theres still some racism but you know basically things are - the assumption things are basically kind of taken care of and theres notion of fairness
